reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Envelope Two: Envelope Two: Increasing resilience and inclusive access to services of Persons with Disabilities through comprehensive protection intervention approach

description.narrative: The proposed project is designed as integrated approach through building on and utilizing previous achievements of the current and previous SCHF projects and contain integrated supports to the vulnerable groups in a dignified accessible way, and designed based on HIHFAD’s previous success in harnessing self-reliance among the most marginalized group as well as in promoting disability inclusive approach among the humanitarian organizations and the communities, the proposed project aims at increasing resilience of people with disabilities (PwDs) and IDPs through community and beneficiary participation through utilizing outreach modality which will focus on improving PwD resilience through set of prevention and response activities that mitigate protection risks, the proposed intervention will be implemented via conducting psychosocial support for people with disabilities and their family members, structured PSS program, problem management (PM+) which affect positively the beneficiary's social network and strengthening the positive lifestyle during their rehabilitation journey. In addition to community inclusion networks, engaging schools to build disability inclusion capacity at education facilities through conducting accessibility audits in selected camps/IDP sites/schools, peer support and child resilience activities, beneficiary led community events, training and awareness sessions on inclusion, Identify and refer, besides 300 beneficiaries( 144 Men, 90 Women, 34 Boys, 32 Girls) who will benefit of individual protection assistance, referrals, and access to socio-economic activities. As continuation of previous achievements, the barriers to socio-economic opportunities and livelihood faced by PwDs which were identified by the evidence report from the ongoing SCHF funded project will be addressed by customized support for PwDs through case management, apprenticeship program and engagement of the private sector by linking employers and potential candidates from PwDs so beneficiaries can gain competitive working skills and knowledge, in addition to the preparation of a list of job seeker with the qualification of each person which will be shared with the interested NGOs to cover any suitable vacancy. Furthermore, the inclusion check list which was created based on IASC guidelines during ongoing SCHF funded project will be used during the proposed project and shared with NGOs through the protection cluster and SCs.

owner-org.narrative: United Nations OCHA Financial Tracking Service (UN OCHA FTS)
